intro: Crepis lacera subsp. lacera, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It has a low-growing habit with a creeping stem that produces numerous flowering shoots. The subspecies lacera is distinguished by its more slender leaves and smaller flowers compared to other subspecies of Crepis.
